text: That’s indeed a very practical problem as well. Illustration: today’s Pharo stores code as a sequence of instructions in Git repositories. But those instructions don’t reflect the order in which the changes were made interactively. If you understand the issues, that’s not too hard to deal with, but it must be hell for beginners.
